messages.text:
Hey <@U07VDFEFBQU> <@U01B2LBUPND>,

We're seeing that customers are trying to select their free cut for the week `2026-01` , but there aren't any free-cuts-menu configured in CCM for that week. Could you please support us with that?
Here you can see the honeycomb dashboard: <https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/A6pZZKaLQYk>

cc <@U027201FQSV> <@U03EN3N4KM4>

<@U0184T48L74>: Hi, I want to report a new Good Chop issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Seamless logic on OS`
*Topic:* `Code Review`
*Priority:* `Medium priority ðŸŸ¡`
*Description:* `Hey team, we realised that there is a call to /activations/checkout/price failing for several WL brands: <https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/gha-cypress-metrics/result/BtsW4ZwSWGK>. Upon further investigation I realised that the issue was introduced with seamless experiment. 

The component that is calling useSeamlessProductPrices (BreakdownDetailsTotal) is not used by MR in the funnel anymore but is used by WL brands post-checkout.

Could you please review/QA my PR removing this logic? 
<https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/60010>

There are more reasons why I think the hook should be totally removed in the description of the PR.
`
*Expected behaviour:* `reduce /activations/checkout/price failure rate`
*Actual behaviour:* `/activations/checkout/price fails with 400`
*Category:* squad-nv-good-chop
*Command:* goodchop-issue
attachments.text:

Upon further investigation I realised that the issue was introduced with seamless experiment.

`

<@UJ182DUEN>: Hi, I want to report a new Good Chop issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Sold out recipes failures in KRS from week 2025-W49 onwards`
*Topic:* `CCM / Menu / AddOns`
*Priority:* `Medium priority ðŸŸ¡`
*Description:* `Hello
It seems that one recipe (index 415) is marked as sold out starting on week 2025-W49 and the recurring selections are failing for customers that selected that index
As it's 4 weeks ahead, we still have sometime, but the customers selection should be fixed with the selection tool in order to avoid having them getting a default selection
More info on the subscriptions and numbers will be put on the thread`
*Expected behaviour:* `N/A`
*Actual behaviour:* `N/A`
*Category:* squad-nv-good-chop
*Command:* goodchop-issue

_thread_replies.text:
Just a heads up: to avoid such errors, you can do the recipe replacement before marking an item as sold out
Not sure if this is visible in your workflow though, but in case it is that would be my recommendation

elements.text:
Just a heads up: to avoid such errors, you can do the recipe replacement before marking an item as sold out
Not sure if this is visible in your workflow though, but in case it is that would be my recommendation

_thread_replies.text:
I dont think it works for our use case: this recipe is sold out starting W49 so customers will keep adding it to their order through W48 and evey time they'll add it future selections will fail. Do you agree?

My plan is to familiarize myself with Bolo's substitution tool and make substitutions every day for W49+ so that customers can still order turkey through W48 without repeating with it past W48. Thoughts?

elements.text:
I dont think it works for our use case: this recipe is sold out starting W49 so customers will keep adding it to their order through W48 and evey time they'll add it future selections will fail. Do you agree?

My plan is to familiarize myself with Bolo's substitution tool and make substitutions every day for W49+ so that customers can still order turkey through W48 without repeating with it past W48. Thoughts?

_thread_replies.text: <@U01B2LBUPND> what would you replace turkey with? Kinda difficult to find meaningful substitution

elements.text: what would you replace turkey with? Kinda difficult to find meaningful substitution

_thread_replies.text:
Iâ€™d substitute turkey with chicken breasts. But this should really be seen as more of a placeholder â€” I donâ€™t believe customers actually intend to repeat with turkey; itâ€™s just a function of how our cut selection carryover works.

By running the substitutions daily, customers will have enough time to update their selections. In other words, doing it daily keeps us 4â€“6â€“8 weeks ahead of the next box, if that makes sense.

elements.text:
Iâ€™d substitute turkey with chicken breasts. But this should really be seen as more of a placeholder â€” I donâ€™t believe customers actually intend to repeat with turkey; itâ€™s just a function of how our cut selection carryover works.

By running the substitutions daily, customers will have enough time to update their selections. In other words, doing it daily keeps us 4â€“6â€“8 weeks ahead of the next box, if that makes sense.

_thread_replies.text: Also note that Iâ€™ll be using Boloâ€™s nifty substitution tool for the first time â€” kind of exciting, as itâ€™ll let us manage discontinuations and menu changes for repeat customers much more effectively.

elements.text: Also note that Iâ€™ll be using Boloâ€™s nifty substitution tool for the first time â€” kind of exciting, as itâ€™ll let us manage discontinuations and menu changes for repeat customers much more effectively.

_thread_replies.text: The turkey sku 145 is never meant to be a recurring selection right? If it's always supposed to be a one-off addition (like a Deal), shouldn't this actually be placed under the Deals selection so it's added as a one-off and so that it doesn't have to be persisted to future weeks?

elements.text: The turkey sku 145 is never meant to be a recurring selection right? If it's always supposed to be a one-off addition (like a Deal), shouldn't this actually be placed under the Deals selection so it's added as a one-off and so that it doesn't have to be persisted to future weeks?

_thread_replies.text: You're right that's always been a discussion, even back during Val's time. But since we wanted to boost turkey sales, we opted to have it part of the core menu. Had we known supply would be tight, we'd have kept it addons only

elements.text: You're right that's always been a discussion, even back during Val's time. But since we wanted to boost turkey sales, we opted to have it part of the core menu. Had we known supply would be tight, we'd have kept it addons only

_thread_replies.text: Another option now that I think about it would be to hide turkey from core menu and substitute in W49+ selections. Let me check with Sam what the email plan is for turkeys

elements.text: Another option now that I think about it would be to hide turkey from core menu and substitute in W49+ selections. Let me check with Sam what the email plan is for turkeys

Oh yeah, that makes sense. I would be nice if we had CCM to be integrated with recurring selection and replacement as well

So I am assuming whenever we get a Soldout error on our end we can ignore it, right?

<@U03QCR5AT6U>: Hi, I want to report a new Good Chop issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `My Delivery page is not rendering all UI properly`
*Topic:* `Bug Report`
*Priority:* `Low priority ðŸŸ¢`
*Description:* `Hi guys,

I was navigating on GoC staging and I noticed the dashboard has some inconsistent behaviours.

1. When I'm on cut-off, I can't see UI for next delivery or modify plan settings
2. In another subscription, only the bottom of the dashboard is visible and the actions in the Plan Setting widget does anything

Not sure if there's some test in course and if this is also happening on live.

If it's expected, just ignore my post and close it :) 

screen shots and account access are following in thread

Thanks`
*Expected behaviour:* `Dashboard present plan settings widget and plan settings CTAs should work`
*Actual behaviour:* `Inconsistent presentation of dashboard between different subscription states and nothing happens by clicking on some plan settings actions`
*Category:* squad-nv-good-chop
*Command:* goodchop-issue

_thread_replies.text:
Hi Jan, thanks for reporting!
Do you mean that in the first screenshot you're not seeing the current order?
If that's the case, I think there was an issue to resolve the url (meaning to add the week parameter automatically) since I've checked both users and I can see the same experience.
Could you please confirm this is the case or share the steps to reproduce it? Thank you :pray:
Sending for reference how the url should automatically add the right week-id parameter.

elements.text:
Hi Jan, thanks for reporting!
Do you mean that in the first screenshot you're not seeing the current order?
If that's the case, I think there was an issue to resolve the url (meaning to add the week parameter automatically) since I've checked both users and I can see the same experience.
Could you please confirm this is the case or share the steps to reproduce it? Thank you
Sending for reference how the url should automatically add the right week-id parameter.

_thread_replies.text: and he is still subscribed to a silo `recipe-previews` which is (by all brands) used for promotional emails to leads. so this is also a reason why he cannot unsubscribe because we have silo not shown to prospects for some reason (similar to the `special-offers` but for formers on which we have a thread ongoing)

_thread_replies.text:
so there are 3 different issues.
1. User Journey setup - already fixed: W45 leads user journey was missing exit criteria, so if user unsubscribes, it will be respected only starting from next week
2. user has 2 initial orders but no subscription, how? 
3. Silo visibility: similar to the case with formers, i just posted in there <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06EH1LF4HW/p1762353956033569?thread_ts=1762338365.064439&cid=C06EH1LF4HW>

recipe-previews
is also not displayed to prospects
can we get both fixed?

*Issue:* `Create new "Corporate Sales" tab in Header (next to Gift Cards)`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Priority:* `Low priority ðŸŸ¢`
*Description:* `The tab should lead to the following URL:  <https://get.goodchop.com/corporate-sales> 

There are 2 types of Headers in our funnel
1. one you can see by going to <http://www.goodchop.com|www.goodchop.com>
2. the other header version is the one you see in <http://www.goodchop.com/plans|www.goodchop.com/plans>

Both headers should now have "Corporate Sales". It should be placed to the left of "Gift Cards"`

*Actual behaviour:* `see above`
